comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: There was a Judge John L. Stevens of Boone, Iowa, according to query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=940CE6DD1630E233A... A John L. Stevens was commodore of the New York Yacht Club in 1851 according to: query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9F01E5DB113FE633A... and another John L. Stevens was a diplomat who conspired to overthrow the Queen of Hawaii in 1893, and died in 1895. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_L._Stevens Only the first seems a candidate based on the period of the Bain photos. He appears to have campaigned for Teddy Roosevelt in 1914. See www.iowastatedaily.com/articles/1999/04/01/import/1999040...

comment.author: 31821737@N06
comment._content: This is Judge John Loomis Stevens who was as well a candidate for governor of Iowa.  My G G Grandfather.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: @Swang, Teddy Roosevelt's last campaign was in 1912, when he ran for President on the Progressive Party "Bull Moose" ticket. In 1914, he was recuperating after his return from a months-long, near-fatal journey through the Amazon wilderness, exploring the River of Doubt.
